title: Correct Enjoyment (and Awareness Raising) of Natura 2000 Locations
abstract: The CORALLO project supports the dissemination and use of the natural heritage through a diverse range of edutainment tools and minor and non-intrusive infrastructure interventions within Natura 2000 (N2K) sites. Through the project, state-of-the-art educational services and facilities will be developed in each of the target sites, including extensive use of virtual and extended reality including documentaries and short video clips. In addition, the iconic species and habitats encountered at each of N2K's target sites will be exhibited in different centers identified for intervention, thus capitalizing on the unique strengths and resources held by each site. The CORALLO project also provides mobile awareness tools, i.e. scientific campaigns for citizens, a boat of project information, smartphone apps and games and online tools, which will allow to reach a wide range of end users. CORALLO wants to achieve a greater degree of awareness of the biodiversity existing within N2K sites and the promotion of related ecosystem services. The project then carries out awareness-raising activities with as many end users as possible.

motivations: There is a need to promote awareness and appreciation of the natural heritage within Natura 2000 locations.
The biodiversity and ecosystem services within Natura 2000 sites are not adequately recognized or utilized by the general public.
objectives: Develop and implement edutainment tools and infrastructure interventions to enhance the dissemination and use of natural heritage within Natura 2000 sites.
Raise awareness of the biodiversity and ecosystem services within Natura 2000 sites among a wide range of end users.
Promote the unique strengths and resources of each Natura 2000 site through targeted exhibitions and educational services.
methods: Develop state-of-the-art educational services and facilities, including virtual and extended reality tools, documentaries, and video clips.
Implement mobile awareness tools, such as scientific campaigns, smartphone apps, games, and online tools, to reach a broad audience.
Utilize iconic species and habitats to exhibit the unique strengths and resources of each Natura 2000 site.
results: Enhance public awareness and appreciation of the biodiversity and ecosystem services within Natura 2000 sites.
Promote the conservation and sustainable use of natural heritage within Natura 2000 locations.
Engage a wide range of end users in the appreciation and protection of Natura 2000 sites.
